LYRICS: How do the innocent come to be murderers? 
A holy call and response silent on one side 
The void now fills with conjecture 
With the terrors projected, 
Virtue falls to me 

With half my mind I’ll consider one half of my enemy 
Every other stanza he writes reads “Hate! Hate! Hate!” 
Behold the beautiful, quick to bastardize and banish the bane 
Stopping up one ear, 
Their voice I distain 

Every voice of reason 
Unified in assent 
Gouging out my merciful eye, 
My soul can clearly see 

Beware the sound 
Of ravenous applause from one hand clapping 
Dredge the chasm 
Between your righteousness
And the wicked ones you know you love to hate 

Let the lines in the sand sink into the fault lines yet again 
Segmenting the sheep and the goats into the molded parts of the palm of God’s hands 
Cast the demons and angels on either side of the stage 
Close the curtain — be aghast 
Blurred lines must not displayed 

Cut loose the bonds of the restraint 
Liberate your hate and disdain 
There is no overkill for the pinnacle, the cynical, the adversary 
No blow can be too austere
For a mind so lost beyond repair 
When we deal in absolutes 
A murder is justified 

Beware the sound 
Of ravenous applause from one hand clapping 
Dredge the chasm 
Between your righteousness 
And the wicked ones you never truly knew 

A flicker of goodness in my enemy must be a mirage

title: EART Telecaster Playthrough
description:
Full disclaimer—this guitar was given to me free of charge in exchange for an honest review. 
I bought my first EART guitar a few months ago. The model was their headless, W2 Strandberg style guitar. Out of all my guitars, I still say that that one is the nicest. This telecaster isn't quiet up to par with that model, however, it still proved to be an excellent guitar for the price tag. The stainless steel frets and the polished fretwork are rarely found with guitars at even double this price point. The action came level and super playable straight out of the box. The paint job is excellent. The pickups were fine to my ears, and would definitely be suitable for recording. The tuners worked well, and didn't pose any problems.
Things I didn't like about the guitar were the nasty green tint of the pickguard (about a month after I shot this video, I replaced with a $15 pearl one I picked up off eBay, and it made it look a whole new instrument), and there was a manufacturer's error in the setup of the pickup (it came lopsided; but after unscrewing the pick guard, I popped it back into place, and it's good as new). 
After playing several telecasters all across the price gamut, I certainly recommend this instrument. That being said,  their W2 headless guitar is still their masterpiece in my book. 

If you're interested in picking up this axe for yourself, you can find it here: https://www.amazon.com/EART-Telecaster-Electric-Fingerboard-Stainless/dp/B08X4JT3BX/ref=cm_cr_arp_d_product_top?ie=UTF8

title: An AWESOME Telecaster for Less than $300?!!?? (Eart Telecaster Unboxing and Review)

title: Perpetua and Felicitas — The Mothers of Martyrdom
description:
This brief video doesn't begin to scratch the surface of their incredible story. 
I highly recommend reading it for yourself. You can find an excellent free translation of the Martyrdom of Perpetua and Felicitas here:

title: I Bought my First NEW Guitar!!!! (EART Headless Guitar W2 Demo & Review)
description:
This is the first time I've ever purchased a brand new guitar. 
I took a leap of faith and bought this random guitar from a company I'd never heard of, and it ended up being the nicest guitar in my arsenal. 
I'm not endorsed or supported by Eart in any way, I just really think they killed it with this product. 
If you're considering an Eart guitar, I've been told to stay away from the tremolo bridges, and that also the painted models might be hit or miss. Otherwise, I whole-heartedly back this guitar.

title: HELIOCENTRIC - Gabriel (Official Music Video)
description:
Recite, recite [1]
The word eternal
The pre-eminent discourse
The dictum of the dead and the living

Deliver the sacred promise—
The birth pangs from God’s own tongue

Your soul is a sea without a shore [2]
Righteous slave,
You’ve caught the eye of the Lord [3]
Pulled straight from the right side of the mountain [4]
They’ll remember your name [5] 

You will speak  
And I’ll silence [6]
The bastards, the reprobates [7] 
The ones who shut their ears to this decree  

The raging oceans [8] 
The weeping orphan [9] 
Will be calmed by its sound   

Galvanize
Dear messenger, 
Those who fell asleep
Refine the corrupted decree 
Level the mountains 
Raise the valleys 

A barren garden births a miracle
A song of unmatched serenity 
Sprouted as a eulogy 
But reaped as a 
Dirge

Watch it pierce your soul [10] 
Your bride and daughter battle [11] 
Black is the ink that’s written
But it dries red [12] 

The final answer
To the question all have asked
And yet a question asking: 
The response, can you withstand?

You will speak  
And be speechless
With awe and dread you’ll bear
The word of God that everyone will hear

The raging oceans
The weeping orphan
Will be calmed by its sound
But not before that deafening wind, overshadowed, has tortured them [13]

Majesty
And terror
Will be a palindrome
Unspeakable its glory 
Unspoken its pain

___________________

Filmed by Kevin Mitchell. 
Directed and Edited by Jared Smith. 

___________________

[1] Quran 96:1-3.
[2] Jalālu’l-Dīn Rūmī, Selected Poems of Rumi, (Mineola, New Yok: Dover Publications: 2011) translated by Reynold A. Nicholson, Dover Thrift Edition, 1.
[3] Luke 1:28.
[4] Quran 19:52. 
[5] Luke 1:42.
[6] ibid., 1:20. 
[7] The Book of Enoch, 10:9.
[8] Mark 4:39.
[9] Muhammad himself was an orphan, with his father dying before his birth, and his mother dying in his adolescence. Raza Aslan, No god but God: The Origins, Evolution, and Future of Islam, chapter 1. See also Quran 93:6.
[10] Isaiah 40:4.
[11] Luke 2:35.
[12] Leslie Hazleton, After the Prophet, chapters 9-10.

title: HELIOCENTRIC - Antithesis (Official Music Video)
description:
This vision lies before me,
The urge to murder the soul
This foreign entity
A stranger inescapable
A face so unfamiliar,
Yet shown in every wayward smile
Behold the lord of the flies:
The impulse swarming in my chest 

Undulate inconsistently 
Wavering sporadically to no resolve
The fate laid out before me slipping away ephemeral, tentative 
   
I am not the author of my wayward dreams
Save mercy for the guilty
Ever-present help in my time of need  
The accuser will acquit me

I hurl my curses to you
Yet find them damning me 
The mirror image that taunts me
The scathing spite that I know
Cancerous contaminant
Ravaging my righteous soul

Despite antipathy, 
I see now my dependence
Though I invite your overthrow
I don't beckon your severance 
Your audience gives me comfort
That my will has been undermined 
If my charity has been usurped
Then damn forgiveness, I'm justified

I am not the author of my wayward dreams
Save mercy for the guilty
I’ll call upon the universal scapegoat
Ever-present help in my time of need  
The accuser will acquit me
I’ll wear my shame underneath a lambskin

You are the embodiment 
of all my avarice
Archetype of my resentment 
You are malevolence in me

"Incarnation is a myth" [1]

[1] Azazeel, Youssef Ziedan, 302. 
_________________

This video is dedicated to my good friend Andrew Gaskin, who provided the manpower, the time, the filming location, and the copious amounts of encouragement to make this video happen. Without his friendship and contribution, this video would never have come to fruition.

title: HELIOCENTRIC - Whispers (Official Music Video)
description:
LYRICS:

Ineffable 
Frozen in beauty,
like a fly caught in amber [1] 
I’m transfixed—
suspended between terror and bliss

Barefoot in the cavern I’ve seen 
The burning thicket, [2] 
Consumed and flickering, radiate
Only the wisps of its shadows [3]
Have been seen by the faithless

But the Word in the beginning
May be my— 

End
these locutions I hear [4] 
The small still voice I can’t—
Bare, I sweat underneath a cacophony 
The clanging of bells
The suffocation an angel’s wings [5] 

Is this my ascent into sainthood
Or am I descending into madness?

If I’m a lyre,  
My chords plucked by God’s own fingers, [6]
Then why does my voice sound strangely familiar?

Where does humanity end and divinity begin? [7] 

So will you hold me through the night? [8] 
As my faith is worn
And terror starts to rise
Only madmen hear the words of angels
And this voice of God terrifies me

It terrifies
And my mind 
Convulses with uncertainty
Has there been a breach of autonomy? [9]
Did my forefather, knife raised, have a lapse in his sanity? [10] 

Did the demons come in?
Am I possessed by a jinn? [11]
Is the devil himself lurking deep within?

Could it be that the angels will catch me up with their hands?  [12] 
Could it be I’m the swine for Christ to throw off the mountain? [13] 

Suicide
May be my only hope
I’ll kill this parasite
Bashing in its wicked host

Concuss the terrible master [14] 
I’ll mitigate this disaster
The lineage of seers might end tonight

Is the line between prophet and madman only paper-thin?

So will you hold me through the night?
As my faith is worn
And terror starts to rise
Only madmen hear the words of angels
And this voice of God terrifies

“Cover me”
I can’t bear the weight of the miracle [15]
Lift my soul with your embrace

Whispers…
___________________

Filmed by Kevin Mitchell. 
Directed and edited by Jared Smith.
___________________

[5] The Hadith by Sahih Al-Bukhari, Volumes 1, book 1, Hadith #2, narrated by Aisha.
[6] Montanus, an early charismatic preacher in the 2nd century, became a spectacle when he not only claimed to be a prophet, but also spoke as God in the first person. “Behold the man [Montanus] is like a lyre, and I strike the strings like a plectrum. The man sleeps and I wake. Behold! It is the Lord who moves the heart of [the] man.” Quoted in Roger E. Olson, The Story of Christian Theology: 20 Centuries of Tradition & Reform, (Downers Grover, IL: InterVasity Press, 1999), 32, Kindle edition.
[7] Lesley Hazleton, The First Muslim: the Story of Muhammad, chapter 8.

[9] T.M. Luhrmann, R. Padmavati, H. Tharoor, and A. Osei, “Differences in Voice-Hearing Experiences of People with Psychosis,” in The British Journal of Psychiatry, 2015, 43.
[10] Carol Delaney, Abraham on Trial, 14.
[11] Mejnoon is the ancient Arabic word for “crazy,” and is still in use to this day all throughout the Near East. The word’s etymology traces its root to the word “jinn.” A jinn in Islam is a spiritual entity separate from angels and demons. There are good jinn and evil jinn. The connotation of the word mejnoon then, is that those who are crazy are those who are possessed by a spirit. This insight is from a personal conversation with Dr. Doug Penney, Wheaton College’s resident Semitic languages scholar.
[12] Matthew 4:6.

[15] The Quran was said to be Muhammad’s sole miracle, given his illiteracy and the Quran’s incomprehensible beauty. Though some scholars question whether Muhammad was in fact illiterate, I choose utilize the term “miracle” because it is still almost universally considered as such among the Muslim community. Raza Aslan, No god but God, chapter 2.

title: HELIOCENTRIC - Never Again (Official Music Video)
description:
LYRICS:

Terror 
Is the ever-scorching sun 
In the fight for our existence

Uprooted, 
Cast aside as kindling
Scattered ‘cross the nations

Sprouted forth
From the crags
Our seed 
A diaspora

Replanted in the land we lost
Nearly vacant but trod upon by swine
We’ll sink our roots deep in this earth
A breast flowing rich with honey

There’s no view from nowhere
And from the heights of Zion I can see

Thorns in my side

Parasitic weeds, 
You infectious disease
We’ll be the salt of the earth 
Terror, homegrown, will wilt and see
We’ve tilled this desert soil before
Our claimed inheritance
Our eternal home

There’s no view from nowhere
And from the heights of Zion I can see
The depths I’ll go to to find 
Refuge

We’ve been pruned for greatness 
The nagging guilt you sow will be blotted out
By the shade of our olive trees
We’ll water this land with blood if it means we reap a future
If only to see our children bloom
I refuse to wither

Never again trod on
Never again uprooted
Never again trod on
Never again a victim

__________________

Filmed by Kevin Mitchell. 
Directed and edited by Jared Smith.

title: Heliocentric - "Moonshine" Official Lyric Video
description:
[1] Graham Greene, The Power and the Glory.

About a year ago, my English professor told my class that we had the choice of either writing a five-page book report, or alternatively, creating something “artistic.” I approached her after the class and asked, “Can I write a metal song as a book report?” She said yes. This is that song. It’s a reflection on the exceptional novel written by Graham Greene called “The Power and the Glory”— an amazing story about an alcoholic priest from Mexico being chased by Communists.

Written and recorded by Jared Smith. 
Mixed and mastered by Isaiah Prather from Prather Audio. https://www.pratheraudio.com/
Video by Jared Smith.

Contra Mundum by Heliocentric is available now available on all major streaming platforms.

And my Dad for always believing in me and helping me make all of this happen.

title: Heliocentric - Moonshine (DEMO VERSION)
description:
For the new and improved, fully produced version of this track, click here: https://youtu.be/b-JjRNKBH_s

Several weeks ago, my English professor told my class that we had the choice of either writing a five page reflection paper or instead, doing something artistic. I approached her after the class and asked, “Can I write a metal song?” She said yes. 
This is that song. It’s a reflection on the exceptional novel written by Graham Greene called “The Power and the Glory”— an amazing tale about an alcoholic priest from Mexico who’s being chased by Communists.
This single was written, recorded, and produced in a college dorm room, because we do what we do bruh.
I’m unendingly indebted to the artistic genius of Nathan Kwon and Kevin Mitchell for their amazing contributions of cover art and video animation respectively. Love you guys.
This song is also available for purchase on Bandcamp here: 
https://heliocentricband.bandcamp.com/releases

Enjoy!
